definition: The aesthetic appreciation of empty spaces that enhance the beauty of surrounding elements.
The effect of sunlight filtering through the leaves of trees.
The space or pause between structural elements, highlighting the beauty of negative space.
The art of finding beauty in imperfection, transience, and simplicity.
A reason for being; the value or purpose that gives meaning to life.
The habit of acquiring books and letting them pile up, often unread.
A poignant awareness of the transience of things, evoking a bittersweet appreciation of life.
A nostalgic, fond remembrance of the past.
An aesthetic of simple, subtle, and unobtrusive beauty.
A profound awareness of the universe that triggers an emotional response too deep for words.
A sense of regret concerning waste; the value of resourcefulness and gratitude for what one has.
The tradition of folding 1,000 origami cranes to make a wish come true.
The art of admiring and taking pleasure in something, often related to nature or a moment in time.
A deep, mysterious sense of the beauty of the universe that transcends words. (Alternate spelling of yūgen.)
A concept that encompasses the heart, mind, and spirit as a unified entity.
A philosophy of continuous improvement in all aspects of life.
A moment of awakening or insight in Zen Buddhism, marking the initial insight into the nature of existence.
The experience of sudden enlightenment in Zen Buddhism, a deep realization of the true nature of reality.
